meanings.sent1: My grandpa used to drive a flivver to work every day.
meanings.sent2: The flivver sputtered and coughed as it struggled up the hill.
meanings.sent3: The kids in the neighborhood loved to play pretend in the old flivver parked in Mr. Johnson's yard.
meanings.sent4: The flivver chugged along like a tired old horse, barely making it to the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The rusty flivver looked like it had seen better days, but it still got us where we needed to go.

meanings.sent1: The squirrel would flivver from tree to tree, gathering nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent2: The leaves flivvered in the wind, creating a beautiful dance of colors in the autumn air.
meanings.sent3: The butterfly seemed to flivver around the garden, never staying in one place for long.
meanings.sent4: Her heart flivvered with excitement as she waited for the results of the competition.
meanings.sent5: The fireflies flivvered in the night, lighting up the darkness with their magical glow.

meanings.definition: A person or thing regarded as worthless or unreliable.
meanings.sent1: Don't listen to him, he's just a flivver who never keeps his promises.
meanings.sent2: The broken clock on the wall was nothing but a flivver, always showing the wrong time.
meanings.sent3: The old mop in the corner was a flivver, shedding more strands than it cleaned up.
meanings.sent4: The leaky faucet was a flivver, wasting water and driving up the utility bill.
meanings.sent5: The cheap umbrella turned out to be a flivver, flipping inside out at the first gust of wind.
